subteams.name: Launch Vehicle
subteams.focus: Design and development of the rocket body, aerostructures, and recovery systems including parachute deployment.

subteams.name: Avionics
subteams.focus: Development of onboard and ground electronics systems, including sensors, telemetry, and CAD for electronics housing.

subteams.name: Payload
subteams.focus: Design and integration of scientific payloads such as rovers, cameras, and gimbals for mission experimentation.

subteams.name: Propulsion
subteams.focus: Development and testing of propulsion systems including combustion chambers, propellant selection, test stands, and ground support equipment.

student_teams.name: MARS Competition
student_teams.description: Hands-on rocket design and launch competition focused on avionics, embedded systems, and aerospace engineering. Participants work on miniaturized rockets with custom flight computers and telemetry systems.

subteams.name: Avionics
subteams.focus: Avionics systems development

subteams.name: Embedded Systems
subteams.focus: Embedded computing for flight systems

subteams.name: Ground Station
subteams.focus: Telemetry and ground communication

student_teams.name: Toronto Autonomous Systems Collective
student_teams.description: A multidisciplinary student engineering team designing and building an autonomous rover. The team integrates mechanical, electrical, and software systems to develop terrain-capable platforms. Subteams focus on mechanical CAD (SolidWorks, Fusion 360, Onshape, AutoCAD), power and energy systems (battery management, PCB design), drivetrain and mobility (suspension systems, traction, motor selection), autonomous navigation (ROS2, GPS, IMU, computer vision), and robotic arm dynamics. The project emphasizes real-world reliability, safety, and systems integration, aligning closely with engineering roles in the automotive and robotics industries.

subteams.name: Mechanical Team
subteams.focus: CAD design, structural design, suspension systems, SolidWorks, AutoCAD

subteams.name: Power Systems
subteams.focus: Battery integration, custom PCBs, BMS, electronics safety

subteams.name: Arm Dynamics
subteams.focus: Robotic manipulators, claw/wrist/base, mechatronics

subteams.name: Autonomous Navigation
subteams.focus: ROS2, GPS/IMU, computer vision, sensor fusion

subteams.name: Communications & Controls
subteams.focus: Navigation algorithms, simulation, controller integration, Python

student_teams.name: MET First Create
student_teams.description: Introductory robotics club where students learn CAD, coding, and 3D printing. Provides hands-on experience with wiring, circuits, and microcontrollers.

student_teams.name: TMU BAJA Racing
student_teams.description: Designs, builds, and races an off-road vehicle in the SAE Baja competition. Students work on real-world automotive engineering challenges across multiple subteams, from powertrain to chassis to electrical systems.

subteams.name: Electrical
subteams.focus: Vehicle electronics, sensors, telemetry systems, and power distribution.

subteams.name: Powertrain
subteams.focus: Engine design, fuel systems, and transmission for peak performance and reliability.

subteams.name: Chassis
subteams.focus: Frame design using steel and aluminum for safety, rigidity, and durability.

subteams.name: Vehicle Dynamics
subteams.focus: Suspension, shock tuning, and geometry optimization for terrain handling and ride quality.

subteams.name: Human Factors
subteams.focus: Driver ergonomics, seating, controls, and overall safety for sustained race performance.

subteams.name: Welding & Operations
subteams.focus: Precision welding for chassis and mounts using MIG, TIG, and stick techniques.

student_teams.name: Toronto Metropolitan Algorithms and Coding Club (TMACC)
student_teams.description: A student-run club focused on solving mathematical and algorithmic problems to improve coding and problem-solving skills. Formerly known as Ryerson CPC, TMACC fosters development in data structures, algorithms, and competitive programming.

subteams.name: Data Structures & Algorithms
subteams.focus: Focuses on core algorithmic and computational problem solving.

subteams.name: Programming Languages
subteams.focus: Discussion and learning across C++, Python, Java, Rust, APL, and JavaScript.

subteams.name: Graph Theory
subteams.focus: Solving problems related to networks, paths, and graphs.

subteams.name: Computer Graphics
subteams.focus: Explores rendering techniques and visual computation.

student_teams.name: Toronto Met Formula Racing
student_teams.description: A student engineering team that designs, builds, and races a Formula-style electric vehicle, sponsored in part by Tesla. The team focuses on areas such as electric powertrains, aerodynamics, and vehicle dynamics, with hands-on experience in CAD, welding, and manufacturing.

subteams.name: Electric Powertrain
subteams.focus: Develops and integrates the electric battery and motor systems, including drivetrain optimization.

subteams.name: Aerodynamics
subteams.focus: Designs aerodynamic elements like wings and undertrays using simulations and wind tunnel testing.

subteams.name: Vehicle Dynamics
subteams.focus: Optimizes suspension, steering, and handling for maximum performance on track.

subteams.name: Chassis & Manufacturing
subteams.focus: Handles frame design, welding, and overall structural integrity of the vehicle using CAD and fabrication tools.

courses.name: Using Python for Research
courses.description: This course bridges the gap between introductory and advanced Python, teaching how to apply Python 3 in research settings. You'll review the basics, then explore tools like NumPy and SciPy for scientific computing, and apply them through case studies. Also includes a new module on machine learning.

courses.name: CS50’s Introduction to Programming with Python
courses.description: An introduction to programming using Python. Covers functions, arguments, return values, variables, types, conditionals, loops, objects, methods, file I/O, and libraries. Designed for students with or without prior experience.

courses.name: CS50’s Introduction to Artificial Intelligence with Python
courses.description: An introduction to the concepts and algorithms at the foundation of modern AI, including search algorithms, knowledge representation, and machine learning. The course is designed for students with a solid understanding of Python.

courses.name: CS50’s Web Programming with Python and JavaScript
courses.description: A deep dive into web programming using Python and JavaScript. Covers front-end and back-end development, including HTML, CSS, Flask, Django, and SQL. Assumes prior knowledge of CS50 or equivalent experience.

courses.name: CS50’s Computer Science for Business Professionals
courses.description: Designed for business professionals, this course covers the fundamentals of computer science and programming. It focuses on how technology can be leveraged in business contexts.

courses.name: CS50’s Computer Science for Lawyers
courses.description: A course tailored for legal professionals, covering the basics of computer science and programming. It focuses on how technology intersects with the legal field.

courses.name: CS50’s Introduction to Computer Science
courses.description: An entry-level course that teaches the fundamentals of computer science and programming. Covers algorithms, data structures, software engineering, and web development.

courses.name: CS50’s Mobile App Development with React Native
courses.description: A comprehensive course on mobile app development using React Native. Covers both iOS and Android platforms, focusing on building cross-platform applications.
